name: snappishly
content:

angrily, or in a way that shows you are easily annoyed: "Of course I know what I'm doing!" she said, snappishly. "That is your business," she answered, quite snappishly. See
snappish
More examplesFewer examples"We should never jump to conclusions," said the Chef snappishly.When newspapers question him, he snappishly says they need to "Grow up."She smiles politely as voter after voter hangs up, or snappishly refuses to answer questions.
